speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: SCENE III. Troy. Before Priam's palace.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Enter HECTOR and ANDROMACHE

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: When was my lord so much ungently temper'd,

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: To stop his ears against admonishment?

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: Unarm, unarm, and do not fight to-day.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: You train me to offend you; get you in:

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: By all the everlasting gods, I'll go!

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: My dreams will, sure, prove ominous to the day.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: No more, I say.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Enter CASSANDRA

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Where is my brother Hector?

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: Here, sister; arm'd, and bloody in intent.

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: Consort with me in loud and dear petition,

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: Pursue we him on knees; for I have dream'd

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: Of bloody turbulence, and this whole night

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: Hath nothing been but shapes and forms of slaughter.

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: O, 'tis true.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Ho! bid my trumpet sound!

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: No notes of sally, for the heavens, sweet brother.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Be gone, I say: the gods have heard me swear.

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: The gods are deaf to hot and peevish vows:

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: They are polluted offerings, more abhorr'd

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Than spotted livers in the sacrifice.

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: O, be persuaded! do not count it holy

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: To hurt by being just: it is as lawful,

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: For we would give much, to use violent thefts,

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: And rob in the behalf of charity.

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: It is the purpose that makes strong the vow;

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: But vows to every purpose must not hold:

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Unarm, sweet Hector.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Hold you still, I say;

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Mine honour keeps the weather of my fate:

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Lie every man holds dear; but the brave man

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Holds honour far more precious-dear than life.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Enter TROILUS

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: How now, young man! mean'st thou to fight to-day?

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: Cassandra, call my father to persuade.

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: Exit CASSANDRA

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: No, faith, young Troilus; doff thy harness, youth;

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: I am to-day i' the vein of chivalry:

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Let grow thy sinews till their knots be strong,

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: And tempt not yet the brushes of the war.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Unarm thee, go, and doubt thou not, brave boy,

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: I'll stand to-day for thee and me and Troy.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Brother, you have a vice of mercy in you,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Which better fits a lion than a man.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: What vice is that, good Troilus? chide me for it.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: When many times the captive Grecian falls,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Even in the fan and wind of your fair sword,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: You bid them rise, and live.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: O,'tis fair play.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Fool's play, by heaven, Hector.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: How now! how now!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: For the love of all the gods,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Let's leave the hermit pity with our mothers,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: And when we have our armours buckled on,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: The venom'd vengeance ride upon our swords,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Spur them to ruthful work, rein them from ruth.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Fie, savage, fie!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Hector, then 'tis wars.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Troilus, I would not have you fight to-day.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Who should withhold me?

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Not fate, obedience, nor the hand of Mars

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Beckoning with fiery truncheon my retire;

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Not Priamus and Hecuba on knees,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Their eyes o'ergalled with recourse of tears;

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Not you, my brother, with your true sword drawn,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Opposed to  hinder me, should stop my way,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: But by my ruin.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Re-enter CASSANDRA, with PRIAM

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Lay hold upon him, Priam, hold him fast:

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: He is thy crutch; now if thou lose thy stay,

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Thou on him leaning, and all Troy on thee,

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Fall all together.

speaker: PRIAM
text_entry: Come, Hector, come, go back:

speaker: PRIAM
text_entry: Thy wife hath dream'd; thy mother hath had visions;

speaker: PRIAM
text_entry: Cassandra doth foresee; and I myself

speaker: PRIAM
text_entry: Am like a prophet suddenly enrapt

speaker: PRIAM
text_entry: To tell thee that this day is ominous:

speaker: PRIAM
text_entry: Therefore, come back.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: AEneas is a-field;

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: And I do stand engaged to many Greeks,

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Even in the faith of valour, to appear

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: This morning to them.

speaker: PRIAM
text_entry: Ay, but thou shalt not go.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: I must not break my faith.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: You know me dutiful; therefore, dear sir,

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Let me not shame respect; but give me leave

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: To take that course by your consent and voice,

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Which you do here forbid me, royal Priam.

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: O Priam, yield not to him!

speaker: ANDROMACHE
text_entry: Do not, dear father.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Andromache, I am offended with you:

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Upon the love you bear me, get you in.

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Exit ANDROMACHE

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: This foolish, dreaming, superstitious girl

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Makes all these bodements.

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: O, farewell, dear Hector!

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Look, how thou diest! look, how thy eye turns pale!

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Look, how thy wounds do bleed at many vents!

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Hark, how Troy roars! how Hecuba cries out!

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: How poor Andromache shrills her dolours forth!

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Behold, distraction, frenzy and amazement,

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Like witless antics, one another meet,

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: And all cry, Hector! Hector's dead! O Hector!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Away! away!

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Farewell: yet, soft! Hector! take my leave:

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Thou dost thyself and all our Troy deceive.

speaker: CASSANDRA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: You are amazed, my liege, at her exclaim:

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Go in and cheer the town: we'll forth and fight,

speaker: HECTOR
text_entry: Do deeds worth praise and tell you them at night.

speaker: PRIAM
text_entry: Farewell: the gods with safety stand about thee!

speaker: PRIAM
text_entry: Exeunt severally PRIAM and HECTOR. Alarums

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: They are at it, hark! Proud Diomed, believe,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I come to lose my arm, or win my sleeve.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Enter PANDARUS

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Do you hear, my lord? do you hear?

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: What now?

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: Here's a letter come from yond poor girl.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Let me read.

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: A whoreson tisick, a whoreson rascally tisick so

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: troubles me, and the foolish fortune of this girl;

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: and what one thing, what another, that I shall

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: leave you one o' these days: and I have a rheum

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: in mine eyes too, and such an ache in my bones

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: that, unless a man were cursed, I cannot tell what

speaker: PANDARUS
text_entry: to think on't. What says she there?

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Words, words, mere words, no matter from the heart:

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: The effect doth operate another way.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Tearing the letter

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Go, wind, to wind, there turn and change together.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: My love with words and errors still she feeds;

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: But edifies another with her deeds.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Exeunt severally
